cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 175 mi (280 km) south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Projected to move north across the Yucatan Channel, strengthen over the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall near the Florida Panhandle late Wednesday, then accelerate northeast across the Southeast U.S. and exit the Mid-Atlantic coast Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect only for Mexico’s Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Cabo Catoche)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Yucatan Peninsula, eastern Gulf Coast (especially Florida Panhandle), then interior Southeast and Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Thursday (20–30 mph with higher gusts)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in upper Chesapeake Bay with present track
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Thursday could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts, producing ponding and localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river/urban flooding and disruptions to landside transport and cargo handling due to rainfall
